Class ViewData

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.ViewData
public final class ViewData extends Object
Immutable data transfer object containing view information for rendering the game state.

This class is part of the View layer in the MVC architecture. It serves as a data container that transfers information from the Model (Board) to the View (GuiController) without exposing internal model details. All data returned by getter methods are defensive copies to maintain immutability.

Coordinate System:

  • xPosition = column (horizontal position)
  • yPosition = row (vertical position)
  • ghostYPosition = row where the brick would land (ghost piece position)
  • Brick data is indexed as brickData[row][col]

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewData

      public ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, int ghostYPosition, int[][] nextBrickData, int score, int totalLines, int highScore)
      Constructs a new ViewData object with the specified brick and score information.
      Parameters:
      brickData - the current falling brick shape matrix (brickData[row][col])
      xPosition - the column position of the brick (x coordinate)
      yPosition - the row position of the brick (y coordinate)
      ghostYPosition - the row position where the brick would land (ghost piece Y coordinate)
      nextBrickData - the next brick preview shape matrix (nextBrickData[row][col])
      score - the current game score
      totalLines - the total number of lines cleared
      highScore - the high score (persists across games)

  • Method Details

    • getBrickData

      public int[][] getBrickData()
      Returns a defensive copy of the current falling brick shape matrix.

      The matrix is indexed as brickData[row][col]. Non-zero values represent filled cells in the brick.

      Returns:
      a deep copy of the brick shape matrix

    • getxPosition

      public int getxPosition()
      Returns the column position (x coordinate) of the current falling brick.
      Returns:
      the x position (column index)

    • getyPosition

      public int getyPosition()
      Returns the row position (y coordinate) of the current falling brick.
      Returns:
      the y position (row index)

    • getGhostYPosition

      public int getGhostYPosition()
      Returns the row position (y coordinate) where the brick would land (ghost piece position).

      This is calculated by simulating downward movement until collision. The ghost piece is displayed at this position to show where the brick will land.

      Returns:
      the ghost Y position (row index where brick would land)

    • getNextBrickData

      public int[][] getNextBrickData()
      Returns a defensive copy of the next brick preview shape matrix.

      The matrix is indexed as nextBrickData[row][col]. Non-zero values represent filled cells in the next brick.

      Returns:
      a deep copy of the next brick shape matrix

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Returns the current game score.
      Returns:
      the current score

    • getTotalLines

      public int getTotalLines()
      Returns the total number of lines cleared in the current game.
      Returns:
      the total lines cleared

    • getHighScore

      public int getHighScore()
      Returns the high score (persists across games).
      Returns:
      the high score
